bwwExcerpt: "Reasons to Be Happy" shares many of the qualities of "Reasons to Be Pretty," which remains LaBute's most mature (and least misogynistic) work to date. But its contemplative dialogue is often overwritten and meandering. Since this is the play's world premiere, it's not too late for LaBute to make edits.
